If I‚Äôm remembered for anything, I hope it‚Äôs the work we‚Äôre doing to help kids in child labor, not my YouTube channel. I‚Äôm all in on this issue.
For the last 18 months I‚Äôve been obsessed with how Feastables can do its part to help kids in child labor on cocoa farms in west Africa. Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôve put in place! https://t.co/P8MdHX4KAL

Btw we pay our farmers a living income, use fair trade certified beans, etc. so I was already spending a lot on cocoa. A random price hike was pretty brutal ngl. 

We‚Äôll figure it out. I feel for small businesses though. Could really be a nail in the coffin for them.
Ironically because of all the new tariffs it is now way cheaper to make our chocolate bars we sell globally NOT in America because other countries don‚Äôt have a 20%+ tariff on our cogs üòÖ

We do routine food drives in America and give millions of meals away for free to Americans each year. If I listed out all the projects we‚Äôve done in America this tweet would be a book. Yet everytime I help people in Africa my top reply is I don‚Äôt help my own country lol
